programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia. (cc)(

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia. (cc)(

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia. (cc).(n)

programme.title: English Premier League Soccer
programme.sub-title: AFC Bournemouth vs. Leicester City FC
programme.desc: Bournemouth was one of only three teams Leicester failed to beat in its Premier League title-winning campaign last season. They played out a 1-1 draw at Vitality Stadium and a 0-0 draw in the reverse fixture.(n)

programme.title: English Premier League Soccer
programme.desc: Sunderland won this exact fixture 3-2 last season with Wahbi Khazri, Fabio Borini and Jermain Defoe all scoring for the Black Cats. Chelsea had been unbeaten in their previous 11 Premier League matches at Sunderland, winning nine of those fixtures(n).(n)

programme.title: English Premier League Soccer
programme.sub-title: Manchester City FC vs. Watford FC
programme.desc: Manchester City is unbeaten in their last nine matches against Watford in all competitions, including all four in the Premier League, a run stretching back to the 1-0 away defeat in the second tier on March 4, 1989 (the goal by Iwan Roberts).(n)

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Sony Open
programme.desc: Sony Open final-round play in Honolulu. (cc)(

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: CareerBuilder Challenge
programme.desc: Final-round play in the $5.8 million CareerBuilder Challenge at PGA West TPC in La Quinta. Bill Haas won this event last year by one shot over five other players when it was known as the Humana Challenge. (cc)(

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Farmers Insurance Open
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Farmers Insurance Open at Torrey Pines in La Jolla, Cal. (cc)(

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Phoenix Open
programme.desc: Final-round play in the $6.5 million Phoenix Open at TPC Scottsdale. Brooks Koepka got his first PGA victory here last season, outlasting three players to win by a single shot. His final round included an eagle on the 15th hole. (cc)(

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Pebble Beach National Pro-Am
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Pebble Beach National Pro-Am. Brandt Snedeker broke his own tournament scoring record here last year, winning this tournament for the second time in three years. He bogeyed only one hole over the course of four rounds. (cc)(

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Northern Trust Open
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Northern Trust Open at the Riviera Country Club in Pacific Palisades, Cal. Bubba Watson shot a 64 in the final round to beat Dustin Johnson by two shots here last year, getting his first victory since the 2012 Masters. (cc)(

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Honda Classic
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Honda Classic in Palm Beach Gardens, Fla. Padraig Harrington got his first Tour win since 2008 here last year, defeating Daniel Berger on the second hole of a playoff. Harrington was behind by four shots with nine holes to play. (cc)(

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: WGC-Cadillac Championship
programme.desc: Final-round play in the $9.5 million WGC-Cadillac Championship at Trump National Doral in Miami. In last year's tourney, Dustin Johnson came from five strokes back in the final round to beat J.B. Holmes by a single shot. (cc)(

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Valspar Championship
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Valspar Championship in Palm Harbor, Fla. Last year, a 30-foot birdie putt on the third hole of sudden death gave Jordan Spieth a victory over Patrick Reed and Sean O'Hair. (cc).(n)

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Arnold Palmer Invitational
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Arnold Palmer Invitational at Bay Hill Golf Club in Orlando. Matt Every won this event for the second straight time last year, knocking down a 17-foot birdie putt on the final hole to defeat Henrik Stenson by a single shot. (cc).(n)

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: WGC-Dell Match Play
programme.desc: WGC-Dell Match Play championship match and third-place match at Austin Country Club. (cc).(n)

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Puerto Rico Open
programme.desc: Puerto Rico Open final-round play at Coco Beach Golf & Country Club in Rio Grande. (cc).(n)

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Houston Open
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Houston Open in Humble, Texas. J.B. Holmes won here last year. (cc).(n)

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: The Heritage
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Heritage on Hilton Head Island, S.C. Jim Furyk got his 17th Tour win and his first since 2010 here last year, defeating Kevin Kisner in a playoff. He shot a 63 in the final round. (cc).(n)

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Valero Texas Open
programme.desc: Final-round play in the $6.2 million Valero Texas Open at TPC San Antonio. (cc).(n)

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Zurich Classic of New Orleans
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Zurich Classic of New Orleans. Justin Rose won a weather-delayed tourney last year, playing 30 holes on Sunday and defeating Cameron Tringale by a single stroke. It was the seventh PGA win for Rose. (cc).(n)

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Wells Fargo Championship
programme.desc: Final-round play in the $7.3 million Wells Fargo Championship in Charlotte. Rory McIlroy dominated this event last year, setting a new tournament scoring record by five shots; shooting a course-record 61 on Saturday; and winning by seven strokes. (cc)(n).(n)

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Players Championship
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Players Championship at the TPC at Sawgrass in Ponte Vedra Beach, Fla. Trailing by five shots with six holes to play, Rickie Fowler played the last six holes at six-under par, forced a playoff and won on the fourth extra hole. (cc)(n).(n)

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: AT&T Byron Nelson
programme.desc: Final-round play at the AT&T Byron Nelson in Irving, Texas. (cc)(n).(n)

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Dean & DeLuca Invitational
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Dean & DeLuca Invitational in Fort Worth. Last year, after Brandt Snedeker missed a 12-foot birdie putt on the final hole, Chris Kirk knocked in a seven-footer for par to win this event by a single stroke. (cc)(n).(n)

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Memorial Tournament
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Memorial Tournament at the Jack Nicklaus-designed Muirfield Village Golf Club in Dublin, Ohio. Last year, Sweden's David Lingmerth defeated Justin Rose on the third hole of a playoff to claim his first PGA Tour win. (cc)(n).(n)

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: St. Jude Classic
programme.desc: Final-round play in the $6.2 million St. Jude Classic in Memphis. Argentina's Fabian Gomez got his first Tour victory in this event last year, shooting a final-round 66 to defeat England's Greg Owen by four shots. (cc)(n).(n)

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Quicken Loans National
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Quicken Loans National at Congressional Country Club in Bethesda, Md. Troy Merritt got his first PGA Tour victory in this event last year in Gainesville, Va., defeating Rickie Fowler by three strokes. (cc)(n).(n)

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Barracuda Championship
programme.desc: Barracuda Championship final-round play at the Montreux Golf and Country Club in Reno. (cc)(n).(n)

programme.title: Ken Burns' Baseball
programme.desc: Eighth inning (1960-70). Bill Mazeroski's 1960 Series-winning home run; Roger Maris's 61 homers in '61; Bob Gibson, Carl Yastrzemski, Stan Musial and Sandy Koufax; football's growing popularity; Marvin Miller and the players' union; Curt Flood's stand against the reserve clause. John Chancellor narrates. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Ken Burns' Baseball
programme.desc: Ninth inning (1970-1993). Game 6 of the '75 Reds-Red Sox World Series; free agency and collusion; the death of Jackie Robinson; Hank Aaron breaks the career HR mark; the "Big Red Machine"; owners Charles Finley and George Steinbrenner; the "curse" of the Red Sox; Roberto Clemente, Pete Rose, Reggie Jackson and Nolan Ryan. John Chancellor narrates. (cc)(n).(n)

programme.desc: ESPN's flagship program provides a thorough presentation of sports news, highlights and analysis. The Emmy-winning show revolutionized the sports-news genre by deftly mixing information with irreverence in a hip, daily scrapbook of homers, touchdowns and slam dunks, the perfect clips-and-controversies fix for sports junkies. The Emmy-winning show revolutionized the sports-news genre by deftly mixing information with irreverence in a hip, daily scrapbook of homers, touchdowns and slam dunks, the perfect clips-and-controversies fix for sports junkies. Staple features besides game scores and highlights include expert breakdowns, `Top Ten Plays', Web polls and trivia. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Original Kings Of Comedy

Cedric the Entertainer headlines with TV stars Bernie Mac, D.L. Hughley and Steve Harvey, entertaining a stadium-size gathering of more than ten thousand fans in this concert film from director Spike Lee(

programme.title: X-Rated 2: The Greatest Adult Stars of All Time
programme.desc: Documentary sequel that offers a close-up look into the personal lives of the legendary porn stars who've survived the test of time and influenced popular culture. Blends rare interviews with erotic clips and additional appearances by Whoopi Goldberg, Steven Soderbergh and a host of adult stars, directors and trendsetters(

programme.title: Hesher
programme.desc: Joseph Gordon-Levitt stars as in this coming-of-age story as a metal head who unexpectedly enters the life of a grieving family and takes on the unlikely role of helping a 13-year-old boy cope with the death of his mother(

programme.title: Song One
programme.desc: Oscar winner� Anne Hathaway stars as a woman whose musician brother is left in a coma following a car accident, leading her to seek out his idols and finding herself falling for an unlikely match in this romantic drama set against the backdrop of Brooklyn's vibrant indie music scene(

programme.title: Hot Rod
programme.desc: Funnyman Andy Samberg stars in his first feature, a zany farce about a development-arrested youth who believes that stunt work is in his blood - despite his many failed, highly hazardous attempts at record-setting on his scooter to the contrary. Sissy Spacek, Ian McShane, Isla Fisher, Jorma Tacone, Bill Hader, Danny McBride and Will Parnell costar in this likable, goofy comedy(

programme.title: Chappie
programme.desc: In the near future, crime is patrolled by a mechanized police force and when a police droid is stolen and given new programming, he becomes the first robot with the ability to think and feel for himself but a powerful, destructive force sees him as a danger to mankind and will stop at nothing to destroy him. Stars Hugh Jackman, Sigourney Weaver and Dev Patel(

programme.title: Unknown Caller
programme.desc: Racing against time, a man must help his family escape their home that has been turned into a time bomb by a phone caller who demands they play his game(

programme.title: Fargo
programme.desc: Written and directed by the Coen brothers, this quirky crime thriller follows the desperate plight of a car salesman who is so far in debt that he hires two thugs to kidnap his own wife so that he can reap the cash ransom from her wealthy father. Stars Frances McDormand, William H. Macy and Steve Buscemi(

programme.title: Gringo: The Dangerous Life of John McAfee
programme.desc: Documentary about the bizarre and scandalous life of tech millionaire John McAfee - famed inventor of anti-virus software - who goes off the grid to live in Belize, building a compound and harem, becoming a drug lord and developing an armed security force to guard himself against the police until he is a suspect in his neighbor's murder and must make a great escape(

programme.title: Weiner
programme.desc: Documentary featuring a jaw-dropping, behind-the-scenes look at the attempted comeback of Anthony Weiner in 2013 as he mounts a campaign for New York City mayor in the wake of his sexting scandal. But it's not long before history repeats itself and new sexting allegations leave Weiner and his aides scrambling to contain the damage. Featuring unfettered access to the candidate and his campaign. Winner of the 2016 Sundance Grand Jury Prize for U.S. Documentary(

programme.title: Zero Days
programme.desc: Documentary from Oscar-winning filmmaker Alex Gibney that explores the phenomenon of Stuxnet, a self-replicating computer virus discovered in 2010 that was allegedly commissioned by the US and Israeli governments to sabotage Iran's nuclear program that opened up a Pandora's box of cyber warfare(

programme.title: Fargo
programme.desc: Written and directed by the Coen brothers, this quirky crime thriller follows the desperate plight of a car salesman who is so far in debt that he hires two thugs to kidnap his own wife so that he can reap the cash ransom from her wealthy father. Stars Frances McDormand, William H. Macy and Steve Buscemi.(n)

programme.title: The Hateful Eight
programme.desc: Eight strangers seek refuge from a blizzard in this Western mystery from writer and director Quentin Tarantino. Features an all-star cast, including Samuel L. Jackson, Kurt Russell and Jennifer Jason Leigh.(n)

programme.title: Casino Royale (2006)
programme.desc: The saga of James Bond, agent 007 of Her Majesty's Secret Service, is given a fresh injection of high-octane thrills with this reboot of the spy series starring Daniel Craig as a newly minted, wet-nosed "blunt instrument" assigned his first mission: take down the sinister La Chiffre, an international arms dealer selling dangerous weapons to terrorists. Eva Green and Judi Dench costar in this box office blockbuster that relaunches the Bond franchise.(n)

programme.title: 2016 Week 14
programme.desc: Exclusive NFL Films highlights of every game, every week of the football season. Plus, hard-hitting commentary and expert analysis from host James Brown, Phil Simms, Boomer Esiason, Michael Irvin and New York Jets Brandon Marshall(c).(n)

programme.title: Blue Velvet
programme.desc: Kyle MacLachlan stars as a college student who returns home after his father has a stroke and discovers a severed ear in an abandoned field. When he attempts to find out what has happened, he is drawn into a dark, depraved and mysterious world. David Lynch directs. Co-stars Isabella Rossellini, Dennis Hopper and Laura Dern.(n)

programme.title: Apartment Troubles
programme.desc: Two codependent roommates, on the verge of eviction, flee New York for the promise of sunshine in Los Angeles where their friendship is tested by a chance at fame, a fortune teller and an amorous wealthy aunt. Features Megan Mullally and Jeffrey Tambor.(n)

programme.title: Cas & Dylan
programme.desc: When a terminally ill doctor reluctantly agrees to give a young woman who is an aspiring writer and social misfit a ride home, the pair end up on a cross country journey that opens their eyes to life's most important lessons. Directed by Jason Priestley.(n)

programme.title: Like Sunday, Like Rain
programme.desc: A 12-year-old rich kid cello prodigy wants for nothing but the attention of his absent parents until a young musician is hired as his au pair and an unexpected friendship blossoms. Stars Leighton Meester and Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: After
programme.desc: When two bus crash survivors awake to discover that they are the only people left in their small town, they must form an unlikely alliance in a race to unravel the truth behind their isolation, as a dark fog concealing danger advances towards the town.(n)

programme.title: Intruders
programme.desc: An agoraphobic woman is isolated from human contact in every way and that is exactly how she likes it. But when a trio of criminals breaks into her old Victorian house on the outskirts of town, they discover there's another side to her psychosis.(n)

programme.title: The Condemned
programme.desc: Ten killers sentenced to death for their murderous crimes are flown to a remote island and pitted against each other in a lethal series of fights, with the ultimate victor winning his freedom as the grand prize. Steve Austin, Vinnie Jones, Robert Mammone and Rick Hoffman star in this bone-cracking, hard-driving action thriller.(n)

programme.title: Rampart
programme.desc: Woody Harrelson stars as a cop who asserts his own code of justice, blurring the lines between right and wrong, but when he gets caught on tape beating a suspect, he finds himself caught in a downwards emotional spiral, amidst a corruption scandal. Also stars Sigourney Weaver, Robin Wright and Ice Cube.(n)

programme.title: Paranoia
programme.desc: When a rising star in the global tech company makes an innocent mistake, he must become a corporate spy to obtain trade secrets from a rival company. But what starts as a clever ruse becomes a life-and-death game of corporate espionage. Stars Liam Hemsworth, Harrison Ford and Gary Oldman.(n)

programme.title: Happily Ever After
programme.desc: Frank and Monica have an interesting proposal for the kids. Lip buckles under pressure from Debbie to get his sobriety under control. Meanwhile, Fiona sees a business opportunity as Kev and V attempt to start a new chapter(n).(n)

programme.desc: Concert special featuring the iconic superstar as she performs in packed arenas around the globe. With exclusive behind-the-scenes access that reveal the pop icon and her legion of dancers as they pour blood, sweat and tears into creating an astonishing arena show celebrated by fans around the world(n).(n)

programme.title: The Honeymooners

programme.title: What Women Want
programme.desc: Electrocuted in a hairdryer mishap, womanizing ad exec Nick Marshall (Mel Gibson) is suddenly able to hear the thoughts of the opposite sex. At first, Nick thinks he's been given a terrific advantage in the bedroom and the boardroom, but soon his psychic gift turns the once-clueless Nick into a better father, employee and man, a transformation that does not go unnoticed by his beautiful boss Darcy (Helen Hunt). Alan Alda, Marisa Tomei, Lauren Holly, Ashley Johnson and Mark Feuerstein costar in this comedy blockbuster(n).(n)
